On Sun, Sep 20, 2009 at 11:34 AM, Bill Burke <bburke@...> wrote:
>
> These are all great points. The output of REST-* is not meant to be an
> academic exercise. We want to create specifications that can be
> implemented and solve specific problems. While our goal is to be
> architecturally pure, software, in general, is very rarely
> architecturely pure when in its final form. As a result, initial
> iterations (and even final ones) maybe a mix of both HTTP and
> REST-centric designs. Remember, WE JUST STARTED!
>

What middleware problems are you trying to solve? I only browsed the
REST-* website, but I didn't see a list of problems the specs are
designed to solve. The overview is the closest thing, but that seems
to just be broad statements like avoiding envelope data formats.

--
David
